intro: Pleocnemia seranensis, commonly known as the Seranese liverwort, is a small, non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its leafy, thalloid structure and is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. The plant exhibits a complex arrangement of leaves, with some species displaying a rosette-like growth pattern. It plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its ecological niche.
